channel.title: dotfiles on Mona Maret
channel.description: Recent content in dotfiles on Mona Maret

item.title: Managing dotfiles
item.description: The first rule of dotfiles is don’t put anything sensitive in them, like passwords or seed words or ssh keys, if you’re going to be checking them into version control. The second rule of dotfiles is don’t put your entire damn ~./config directory into version control because that includes a lot of sensitive info and thus violates the first rule. Okay, let’s get serious now that the warnings are out of the way.
